intro: Senecio apolobambensis, commonly known as the Apolobamba senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
